notes.title: WEEK 1
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 1: Recovering a Sense of Safety

Focus: Healing creative wounds + building trust in your inner artist by naming shame, silencing your critic, and showing up gently.

âœ¨ Core Chapter Themes ğŸ§  Shame, fear, and criticism block creative flow ğŸ‘¹ Meet your inner critic (â€œThe Censorâ€) ğŸ’› Reconnect with safety, play, and self-trust ğŸ“‹ Weekly Tasks (pick your favs) ğŸ§  Creative Champions â€“ list people who encouraged you ğŸ˜” Creative Monsters â€“ list people who discouraged you; write an unsent letter ğŸª Affirmations + Censor Reframes â€“ write 10 affirmations, then challenge the â€œblurtsâ€ ğŸŒˆ Imaginary Lives â€“ list 5 dream lives ğŸ­ Inhabit 1 Imaginary Life â€“ live one in a small way ğŸ§¸ Childhood Joy â€“ favorite toy or creative memory ğŸ–ï¸ Draw Your Inner Artist â€“ as a child (stick figures welcome) âª Time Travel â€“ Positive memories of creative encouragement â© Time Travel â€“ Negative memories that still affect you ğŸ§¼ Support Inventory â€“ who uplifts vs. drains your creativity âœï¸ Reflection Prompts ğŸ–Šï¸ When has creativity felt safe or joyful? ğŸ–Šï¸ How does your environment affect creative risks? ğŸ–Šï¸ Whatâ€™s the difference between your Censor + your true voice? ğŸŒ€ End of Week Check-In ğŸ““ Did you do Morning Pages? ğŸ¨ Did you go on an Artist Date? ğŸ” Any synchronicities or emotional shifts? ğŸ’­ What resonated or felt hard? ğŸ’¬ How are you feeling creatively?

notes.title: WEEK 2
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 2: Recovering a Sense of Identity

Focus: Reclaiming your creative identity by releasing external expectations, setting boundaries, and rediscovering what you want to say, make, and explore.

âœ¨ Core Chapter Themes ğŸ§  Noticing how othersâ€™ opinions shaped your self-concept ğŸš« Saying no to people-pleasing and over-responsibility ğŸ§â€â™€ï¸ Stepping into authenticity and creative self-definition ğŸ“£ Beginning to hear your own voice again ğŸ“‹ Weekly Tasks (choose your favs) ğŸª© Look for â€œPoisonous Playmatesâ€ â€“ who distracts or drains you? ğŸšª Practice setting small, safe boundaries ğŸ§  List things you used to enjoy that youâ€™ve stopped doing ğŸ–¼ï¸ Reclaim one forgotten interest or curiosity this week ğŸ—£ï¸ Write about something youâ€™ve been afraid to say out loud ğŸ“š Declutter your mental space: limit unhelpful input (news, gossip, social scrolling) ğŸ§ Pay attention to what energizes or exhausts your creative self ğŸ§¹ Identify places youâ€™re over-helping or over-doingâ€”then step back gently ğŸ§â€â™€ï¸ Ask: What do I want to create for meâ€”not for approval? âœï¸ Reflection Prompts ğŸ–Šï¸ Where have I lost pieces of my creative identity? ğŸ–Šï¸ What do I want more of in my creative lifeâ€”and what do I need less of? ğŸ–Šï¸ How can I begin to trust my voice, my choices, and my pace? ğŸŒ€ End of Week Check-In ğŸ““ Did you do Morning Pages? ğŸ¨ Did you go on an Artist Date? ğŸ” Any synchronicities, nudges, or shifts in perspective? ğŸ’­ What felt hard or sticky this week? ğŸ’¬ What are you learning about your creative self?

notes.title: WEEK 3
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 3: Recovering a Sense of Power

Focus: Reclaiming personal power by using emotions like anger, shame, and resistance as creative fuel rather than blocksâ€”learning to trust what you feel and act on what you need.

âœ¨ Core Chapter Themes ğŸ”¥ Anger is a mapâ€”pay attention to it ğŸ™…â€â™€ï¸ Resistance signals growth, not failure ğŸ§± Shame and fear block expression ğŸ§  Truth-telling unlocks creative energy ğŸ“‹ Weekly Tasks (choose your favs) ğŸ”¥ Make an â€œAnger Listâ€ â€“ what pissed you off recently? Whatâ€™s it pointing to? ğŸ™‹â€â™€ï¸ Journal where you feel blocked and who/what might be contributing ğŸ§  Track resistance this weekâ€”when did it show up and why? ğŸ“œ Write about one shaming moment from your pastâ€”get it out ğŸ¯ Do something youâ€™ve been avoiding creatively (even one tiny step!) ğŸ—£ï¸ Say what you mean at least once this weekâ€”no sugarcoating ğŸ§â€â™€ï¸ Make a mini â€œI wantâ€ listâ€”no edits, just honesty ğŸ’¥ Identify where youâ€™ve been hiding or holding back in your art ğŸ’Œ Write a love letter to your boldest creative self ğŸŒ± Reflect on the power of truth in your pagesâ€”whatâ€™s rising up? âœï¸ Reflection Prompts ğŸ–Šï¸ What is my anger trying to tell me? ğŸ–Šï¸ Where do I feel creatively silencedâ€”and why? ğŸ–Šï¸ Whatâ€™s one brave step I can take toward expressing what you really want? ğŸŒ€ End of Week Check-In ğŸ““ Did you do Morning Pages? ğŸ¨ Did you go on an Artist Date? ğŸ” Any resistance, breakthroughs, or strong feelings this week? ğŸ’­ What patterns or insights emerged? ğŸ’¬ Whatâ€™s feeling powerful or uncomfortable in your process?

notes.title: WEEK 4
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 4: Recovering a Sense of Integrity

Focus: Realigning with your truth by clearing out distractions, becoming more honest with yourself, and listening deeply to what your inner artist actually needsâ€”without numbing, avoiding, or overconsuming.

âœ¨ Core Chapter Themes ğŸ›‘ Reading deprivation = clarity, not punishment ğŸ§˜â€â™€ï¸ Distraction is often disguised avoidance ğŸ§  Telling the truth (even to yourself) restores creative power ğŸ’¡ Integrity is about alignmentâ€”doing what feels real and right ğŸ“‹ Weekly Tasks (choose your favs) ğŸ“µ Reading Deprivation â€“ one week of no books, articles, or content consumption ğŸ““ Use Morning Pages to process your reactions to less input ğŸ‘€ Notice what you want to read when you canâ€™tâ€”whatâ€™s the craving covering up? ğŸ–¼ï¸ Make space to hear your inner voice without noise ğŸ§¹ Declutter something physicalâ€”mirror the internal shift ğŸ§ Choose silence or music over media when possible âœï¸ Freewrite a truth youâ€™ve been avoiding ğŸš« Track when/why you feel the urge to distract yourself ğŸ” What donâ€™t you want to see or hear right now? Be curious, not harsh ğŸ—£ï¸ Begin to say what you really mean (on paper or aloud) âœï¸ Reflection Prompts ğŸ–Šï¸ What does â€œintegrityâ€ mean for me as a creative person? ğŸ–Šï¸ When do I feel most aligned, honest, or real? ğŸ–Šï¸ How do I avoid my truthâ€”and what helps me return to it? ğŸŒ€ End of Week Check-In ğŸ““ Did you do Morning Pages? ğŸ¨ Did you go on an Artist Date? ğŸ“µ How did reading deprivation feel? What surfaced in the quiet? ğŸ’­ What did you discover about your habits, truth, or needs? ğŸ’¬ Where are you craving more honesty or alignment?

notes.title: WEEK 5
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 5: Recovering a Sense of Possibility

Focus: Challenging the limiting beliefs that keep you small and opening up to the idea that more is possible for youâ€”more freedom, more creativity, more joy. This week is about saying yes to potential and no to self-doubt.

âœ¨ Core Chapter Themes ğŸ§  Scarcity mindset keeps us stuck ğŸšª Limiting beliefs can be rewritten ğŸ’¡ Wanting more doesnâ€™t make you selfish ğŸŒ± Possibility grows from curiosity and action ğŸ“‹ Weekly Tasks (choose your favs) ğŸ’­ List your limiting beliefs (e.g., â€œIâ€™m too late,â€ â€œArt doesnâ€™t payâ€) ğŸ” Reframe those beliefs with new truths ğŸ§  Track how many times you say â€œI canâ€™tâ€ this week ğŸŒŸ Make a list of 10 creative wishesâ€”be bold ğŸ¯ Choose one and take one small step toward it ğŸ“¸ Vision Board or Pinterest dream board session âœï¸ Write a letter from your future, creatively fulfilled self ğŸ›‘ Notice where you self-sabotage or expect the worst ğŸ§¹ Clear something physical or digital to make space for â€œmoreâ€ ğŸ§ Listen for moments of inspirationâ€”follow where they lead âœï¸ Reflection Prompts ğŸ–Šï¸ What do I want that Iâ€™ve been afraid to name? ğŸ–Šï¸ What beliefs about creativity or success need to be challenged? ğŸ–Šï¸ Where in my life is â€œpossibilityâ€ trying to break through? ğŸŒ€ End of Week Check-In ğŸ““ Did you do Morning Pages? ğŸ¨ Did you go on an Artist Date? ğŸ’­ Did any old stories come up this week? ğŸŒ± Where did you feel stretched, hopeful, or challenged? ğŸ’¬ What possibility are you starting to believe in again?

notes.title: WEEK 6
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 6: Recovering a Sense of Abundance

Focus: Shifting from scarcity to sufficiency by examining your beliefs around money, worth, and creative value. This week helps you notice where you limit yourselfâ€”and start inviting more support, joy, and overflow into your life.

âœ¨ Core Chapter Themes ğŸ’¸ Scarcity mindset restricts creativity ğŸ§  Money stories are often inherited and untrue ğŸ’› Treating yourself with care builds belief ğŸ Abundance is a mindset, not a number ğŸ“‹ Weekly Tasks (choose your favs) ğŸ“œ Write your money storyâ€”what you were taught, what you believe ğŸ§  List your top 5 scarcity thoughts (then reframe them) ğŸ’° Track how you spend and where you withhold (especially from yourself) ğŸ Buy yourself one small, meaningful creative treat ğŸ§º Declutter and donate somethingâ€”create flow ğŸ“¸ Create a â€œrich lifeâ€ moodboard (what abundance feels like for you) âœï¸ Journal: What would I create if I felt totally supported? ğŸ” Practice 3 daily affirmations about money, joy, or ease ğŸ›ï¸ Notice what feels luxurious and nourishingâ€”not performative ğŸŒ· Plan a low-cost Artist Date that feels decadent âœï¸ Reflection Prompts ğŸ–Šï¸ Where am I still afraid to receive more? ğŸ–Šï¸ What do I truly believe Iâ€™m worthy of? ğŸ–Šï¸ How does abundance already exist in my life? ğŸŒ€ End of Week Check-In ğŸ““ Did you do Morning Pages? ğŸ¨ Did you go on an Artist Date? ğŸ’­ What scarcity patterns surfaced this week? ğŸ’› Where did you allow more pleasure, ease, or enoughness? ğŸ’¬ What does abundance look and feel like for you?

notes.title: WEEK 7
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 7: Recovering a Sense of Connection

Focus: Deepening trust in your creative path by tuning into intuition, synchronicity, and the quiet voice within. This week reminds you that youâ€™re not doing this aloneâ€”creative flow is always available when you listen and follow the nudges.

âœ¨ Core Chapter Themes ğŸ”® Intuition is a real and reliable guide ğŸŒŒ Synchronicity = creative alignment ğŸŒ€ Flow happens when we release control ğŸ§˜â€â™€ï¸ Self-doubt often masks deeper knowing ğŸ“‹ Weekly Tasks (choose your favs) ğŸ§  List recent moments of synchronicity (no matter how small) ğŸ” Track where youâ€™ve ignored your gutâ€”and what happened ğŸ““ Journal: What does â€œintuitionâ€ feel like in your body? ğŸ§ Follow one creative nudge this week, even if it makes no sense ğŸ’« Spend time in stillnessâ€”let thoughts come without forcing ğŸ–¼ï¸ Create something without planning or editing ğŸ—£ï¸ Ask your inner artist a question in writingâ€”then let them answer ğŸ“œ Write about a time something worked out in a surprising, perfect way ğŸ¨ Let your Artist Date be spontaneous and unstructured ğŸ’­ Journal about what you want to believe about flow, connection, and ease âœï¸ Reflection Prompts ğŸ–Šï¸ Where have I felt spiritually or creatively guided? ğŸ–Šï¸ What does creative flow look like in my life? ğŸ–Šï¸ Where can I stop forcing and start trusting? ğŸŒ€ End of Week Check-In ğŸ““ Did you do Morning Pages? ğŸ¨ Did you go on an Artist Date? ğŸ’« Noticed any synchronicities or intuitive hits? ğŸ§  Where did you feel mentally blockedâ€”or spiritually supported? ğŸ’¬ How are you connecting with your creative source right now?

notes.title: WEEK 8
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 8: Recovering a Sense of Strength

Focus: Reclaiming your creative strength by telling the truth, honoring your past, and allowing your pain and power to coexist. This week invites deep emotional honestyâ€”and the courage to use your story as fuel, not a wound.

âœ¨ Core Chapter Themes ğŸ§± Unprocessed pain drains creative energy ğŸ—£ï¸ Truth-telling restores personal power ğŸ’ª Strength = vulnerability, not avoidance ğŸ§  Memory holds both insight and limitation ğŸ“‹ Weekly Tasks (choose your favs) ğŸ““ Journal through a difficult memory and what it still teaches you ğŸ§  Identify one old belief that no longer fitsâ€”rewrite it ğŸ› ï¸ Make a list of times youâ€™ve been strong, even when it didnâ€™t feel like it ğŸ“œ Write a forgiveness letter (to yourself or someone else) you donâ€™t have to send ğŸ’¥ Take a creative risk this weekâ€”big or small ğŸ–¼ï¸ Create a piece of â€œtruth artâ€â€”a photo, poem, drawing, or playlist that reflects how you really feel ğŸ§¹ Let go of something that no longer supports your growth (physical or emotional) ğŸ”’ Make a list of things that are just for youâ€”no explanation needed ğŸ“£ Voice one boundary youâ€™ve been holding back ğŸ’Œ Write your younger creative self a letter of encouragement and strength âœï¸ Reflection Prompts ğŸ–Šï¸ What truth have I been afraid to say out loud? ğŸ–Šï¸ Where have I underestimated my own strength? ğŸ–Šï¸ How can I create from a place of honesty instead of perfection? ğŸŒ€ End of Week Check-In ğŸ““ Did you do Morning Pages? ğŸ¨ Did you go on an Artist Date? ğŸ’­ What truths surfaced this weekâ€”emotionally or creatively? ğŸ’ª Where did you feel brave, stretched, or confronted? ğŸ’¬ What parts of you are growing stronger?

notes.title: WEEK 9
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 9: Recovering a Sense of Compassion

Focus: Softening self-judgment and embracing imperfection as part of the creative process. This week is about meeting your inner artist with patience, kindness, and graceâ€”especially when you fall short or feel stuck.

âœ¨ Core Chapter Themes ğŸ§¸ Perfectionism stifles creativity ğŸ’› Self-compassion fosters momentum ğŸ§  Creative recovery is non-linear ğŸ“‰ Shame and comparison are creativity killers ğŸ“‹ Weekly Tasks (choose your favs) ğŸ§  Notice your self-talk this weekâ€”write down whatâ€™s kind vs. whatâ€™s critical ğŸ““ Journal through one recent moment of self-judgment and reframe it âœï¸ Write a letter of encouragement to your current self from your future self ğŸŒ± List 10 ways youâ€™ve grown creatively since starting this journey ğŸ¨ Make something intentionally imperfectâ€”and celebrate it ğŸ’¬ Name one area where youâ€™re doing â€œenough,â€ even if itâ€™s not perfect ğŸ§˜â€â™€ï¸ Rest on purposeâ€”schedule it like it matters ğŸ“¸ Look at your early creative work and find something to love in it ğŸ§â€â™€ï¸ Practice showing up as you are this week, not who you think you â€œshouldâ€ be ğŸ“œ Write down 3 affirmations that feel gentle but powerful âœï¸ Reflection Prompts ğŸ–Šï¸ Where am I still holding myself to unrealistic standards? ğŸ–Šï¸ What would I say to a friend in my situation? Can I say it to myself? ğŸ–Šï¸ How can I show up creatively without needing to prove anything? ğŸŒ€ End of Week Check-In ğŸ““ Did you do Morning Pages? ğŸ¨ Did you go on an Artist Date? ğŸ’­ What moments required compassion this week? ğŸ’› Where did you notice perfectionism or pressure creeping in? ğŸ’¬ How can you be a softer, safer place for your inner artist to land?

notes.title: WEEK 10
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 10: Recovering a Sense of Self-Protection

Focus: Learning to honor and protect your creative energy by setting boundaries, filtering feedback, and being discerning about what (and who) gets access to your artistic heart.

âœ¨ Core Chapter Themes ğŸ›¡ï¸ Creativity needs protection, not constant exposure âŒ Not all feedback is helpful ğŸ“µ Discernment creates freedom ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Overexposure = burnout, not bravery ğŸ“‹ Weekly Tasks (choose your favs) ğŸ§  Track how often you overshare, overgive, or overexpose your work âœï¸ Journal about what feels unsafe creativelyâ€”and why ğŸ›‘ Set one boundary around time, energy, or access this week ğŸ­ Write about a time you regretted sharing your creativity too early ğŸ“œ Make a list of people whose feedback you trustâ€”and those you donâ€™t ğŸ§˜â€â™€ï¸ Practice saying â€œnot right nowâ€ when something doesnâ€™t serve your energy ğŸ’¬ Explore what kind of feedback you actually want or need ğŸ“¸ Take a social media detox or limit your exposure ğŸ“¦ Reclaim a private projectâ€”something just for you ğŸ’Œ Write a vow to protect your creative self going forward âœï¸ Reflection Prompts ğŸ–Šï¸ Where do you feel most drained or overexposed creatively? ğŸ–Šï¸ How do you know when youâ€™ve hit your limit? ğŸ–Šï¸ What boundaries help you feel safe, not selfish? ğŸŒ€ End of Week Check-In ğŸ““ Did you do Morning Pages? ğŸ¨ Did you go on an Artist Date? ğŸ›¡ï¸ Where did you practice self-protection this week? ğŸ’­ What changed when you held a boundary or created space? ğŸ’¬ How will you protect your creative energy moving forward?

notes.title: WEEK 11
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 11: Recovering a Sense of Autonomy

Focus: Strengthening your creative independence by reclaiming your choices, honoring your rhythms, and trusting your voice without needing external approval. This week is about being the authority in your own artistic life.

âœ¨ Core Chapter Themes ğŸ§­ You are your own creative compass ğŸ“£ Approval-seeking blocks authenticity ğŸ” Routine creates freedom ğŸ§˜â€â™€ï¸ Self-direction is sacred and sustainable ğŸ“‹ Weekly Tasks (choose your favs) ğŸ§  List all the areas where youâ€™re still waiting for permission ğŸ““ Journal about one decision youâ€™d make if no one elseâ€™s opinion mattered ğŸ” Notice when you self-correct, censor, or shrink back ğŸ¯ Do one thing this week your way, even if itâ€™s small ğŸ“œ Write a declaration of creative independence ğŸ—“ï¸ Design your ideal creative weekâ€”based on how you actually work ğŸ’¬ Practice saying â€œI choose this because it feels right to meâ€ ğŸ§â€â™€ï¸ Revisit old goalsâ€”are they truly yours, or someone elseâ€™s? ğŸ“£ Share something with yourself firstâ€”before asking for feedback ğŸ§© Say no to one thing that no longer fits the creative path youâ€™re building âœï¸ Reflection Prompts ğŸ–Šï¸ Where in my life do I crave more freedom and self-trust? ğŸ–Šï¸ What does creative autonomy mean to me? ğŸ–Šï¸ How can I stop outsourcing decisions and start choosing from within? ğŸŒ€ End of Week Check-In ğŸ““ Did you do Morning Pages? ğŸ¨ Did you go on an Artist Date? ğŸ§­ Where did you trust yourself more this week? ğŸ’­ What choices felt liberating or aligned? ğŸ’¬ How are you stepping into creative independence?

notes.title: WEEK 12
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 12: Recovering a Sense of Faith

Focus: Embracing creative trust and surrendering to the flow of your artistic path. This final week is about moving forward with courageâ€”not because everything is certain, but because youâ€™ve built a deeper relationship with yourself, your process, and your purpose.

âœ¨ Core Chapter Themes ğŸ•Šï¸ Creativity is cyclicalâ€”rest, risk, and rise ğŸŒŠ Faith means trusting the process, not the outcome âœ¨ Synchronicity follows self-alignment ğŸ›¤ï¸ Your path unfolds as you keep showing up ğŸ“‹ Weekly Tasks (choose your favs) ğŸ““ Reflect on how your creative faith has changed over 12 weeks ğŸ§  List what you now believe is possible for you ğŸ—“ï¸ Create a 12-week post-TAW â€œwhatâ€™s nextâ€ planâ€”loose, intuitive, real ğŸ’« Journal about a time you trusted your creative gut and it worked ğŸ“œ Write a commitment statement to your artist self ğŸ“¦ Make a list of things youâ€™re ready to release ğŸª Review past Morning Pagesâ€”notice growth, shifts, themes ğŸ§˜â€â™€ï¸ Design your own Artist Ritualâ€”something to keep you anchored ğŸ“£ Declare your faith publicly or privately (only if it feels empowering) ğŸ§­ Make a â€œcreative compassâ€ with words, visuals, or values to guide you forward âœï¸ Reflection Prompts ğŸ–Šï¸ What does creative faith mean to me now? ğŸ–Šï¸ Where do I still struggle to trustâ€”and where have I already grown? ğŸ–Šï¸ What helps me stay connected to flow when doubt returns? ğŸŒ€ End of Week Check-In ğŸ““ Did you do Morning Pages? ğŸ¨ Did you go on an Artist Date? ğŸ’­ What does this 12-week journey mean to you now? ğŸŒ± Whatâ€™s opening up for you nextâ€”emotionally or creatively? ğŸ’¬ What part of yourself are you walking forward with?
